page.title: 09WOKINGHAM _ LANDSCAPE
page.content: The town of Wokingham is surrounded by {arable and grazing land}. The area is dominated by{transport routes}, largely in an East to West direction viz. M4, A329(M) and the Southern Region Railway. Large{housing estates have been built in the Embrook, Crutchley Road, Bean Oak Road and Woosehill areas.{Farms}have amalgamated, rarely do we find tenant farmers. Former{farmhouses}have been sold purely for residential use. {Fields}are larger,{hedgerows}have been eradicated for economic purposes, to the detriment of wildlife. Architecturally Wokingham has two main buildings, the Old and New{Town Halls} and large buildings for{light industry appear in the Molly Millar's Lane area. Denmark Street has been recently rebuilt in a new style in keeping with older structures.
